column4: i have a problem, i need to install ubuntu in a HD and i cant boot from a live usb, i get boot error when i try to boot from usb
ive tried unetbootin, startup disk creator, universal usb creator and live linux. Ive tried formating in windows to FAT32
what usb disk is it? (i couldnt get a bootable wd for example)
i have a kingston 4 GB and a 2Gb micro sd with a converter
both of them faileed
whats the error?
just BOOT ERROR
what os is installed now, and does that boot?
i have ubuntu 11 right now
brontosaurusrex:
and that will boot just fine?
did you try booting that same usb device on another computer?
yes, the same result, boot error
these are the two pendrives http://www.freeimagehosting.net/01b92  http://www.freeimagehosting.net/c3086
does your hash (md5) checks ?
for the iso i mean
yes, everything ok
the puppy one 2GB and the ubuntu 10 386 4 GB
have any other usb disks to try?
wow i just have two..
well, just my experience, i got the boot working with my oldest external drive, something packed into icybox, so ...
so i have 2 usb drives, 3 pcs and i still cannot boot from usb,, amazing
there is something problematic with the specific usb drives or your procedure of making those
